title: CVPR_2008_258_abs

sentences.text: We propose a novel step toward the unsupervised seg-mentation of whole objects by combining '' hints '' of partial scene segmentation offered by multiple soft , binary mattes .
These mattes are implied by a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments in the scene .
Rather than trying to find or define a single '' best '' segmentation , we generate multiple segmentations of an image .

This reflects contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images , and it allows us to define intuitive evaluation met-rics for our sets of segmentations based on the accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects .
Our proposed approach builds on recent advances in spectral clustering , image matting , and boundary detection .
It is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes and is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge .

Entity-we_propose.description: A new approach to unsupervised object segmentation that combines 'hints' from partial scene segmentations and multiple soft/binary mattes.

summary: We propose a novel step toward the unsupervised seg-mentation of whole objects by combining '' hints '' of partial scene segmentation offered by multiple soft , binary mattes . These mattes are implied by a set of hypothesized object boundary fragments in the scene . Rather than trying to find or define a single '' best '' segmentation , we generate multiple segmentations of an image . This reflects contemporary methods for unsupervised object discovery from groups of images , and it allows us to define intuitive evaluation met-rics for our sets of segmentations based on the accurate and parsimonious delineation of scene objects . Our proposed approach builds on recent advances in spectral clustering , image matting , and boundary detection . It is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes and is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge .

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To propose means to suggest or put forward an idea, plan, or solution for consideration and potential implementation. The predicate 'propose' connects the subject (the entity making the proposal) with the object (the proposed concept, action, or course of action), indicating that the subject is advocating for or supporting the object.

Predicate-are_implied_by.label: are implied by
Predicate-are_implied_by.description: The predicate 'are implied by' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. These mattes) has its meaning or significance derived from, or logically connected to, the object (e.g. set of hypothesized object boundary fragments). In this sense, the subject's characteristics are inferred or suggested through their association with the object.

Predicate-are.label: are
Predicate-are.description: The predicate 'are' indicates that there exists an equivalence or correspondence between the subject and the object. It suggests a state of being where both entities share similar characteristics, properties, or attributes.

Predicate-reflects.label: reflects
Predicate-reflects.description: The predicate 'reflects' indicates a relationship where the subject represents or embodies the characteristics, principles, or ideas described by the object. In general, it suggests that the subject has internalized or incorporated the qualities or concepts expressed by the object.

Predicate-builds_on.label: builds on
Predicate-builds_on.description: Indicates that the subject relies upon or draws inspiration from the object to create a foundation for its own existence, development, or understanding. The predicate 'builds on' suggests a relationship of dependence, where the subject leverages the ideas, concepts, or principles contained in the object as a starting point or basis for further exploration.

Predicate-is_demonstrated_qualitatively_.label: is demonstrated qualitatively and quantitatively on a dataset of scenes
Predicate-is_demonstrated_qualitatively_.description: This predicate indicates that the subject's properties or characteristics are showcased through a comprehensive representation provided by the object - a dataset of scenes. The connection between the subject and the object suggests an empirical demonstration, where the subject's attributes are illustrated using concrete examples from the scene data.

Predicate-is_suitable_for_current_work_i.label: is suitable for current work in unsupervised object discovery without top-down knowledge
Predicate-is_suitable_for_current_work_i.description: This predicate indicates that a subject (e.g., dataset of scenes) possesses characteristics or properties that enable it to be effectively utilized for performing unsupervised object discovery without relying on prior knowledge. In other words, the subject has attributes that make it suitable for this specific task.

Predicate-combine.label: combine
Predicate-combine.description: To combine means to unite or merge two or more things into a single entity, often resulting in a new whole that exhibits properties of its constituent parts. This predicate suggests an integration process where distinct elements are brought together to form a cohesive unit.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject (in this case, a concept or method) is related to another more general concept or category. It suggests an hierarchical relationship between the two entities, where the object represents a higher-level abstraction or classification.
